notes: First-generation Explorer launched as replacement for Bronco II. Based on Ranger platform with independent front suspension. Uses timing chain (4.0L V6). Early 4R55E transmissions (1995+) prone to failure. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Explorer article, October 2025 revision.

Second generation introduced SOHC V6 with timing chains. Optional 5.0L V8 available. Firestone tire recall in 2000-2001 affected safety reputation. Control Trac 4WD system standard on 4x4 models. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Explorer article, October 2025 revision.

SN95 generation represents major redesign on Fox platform. Introduced modular V8 (4.6L) in 1996. Cobra models feature DOHC V8 with timing chains. All engines use timing chains except 3.8L V6. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Mustang (fourth generation) article, October 2025 revision.

Final generation full-size Bronco on F-Series truck platform. All engines use timing chains. E4OD transmission standard with electronic controls. Production ended 1996 after O.J. Simpson chase. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Bronco article, October 2025 revision.

Tenth generation introduced modular Triton V8 engines replacing Windsor V8s. All Triton engines use timing chains. First generation with 4-door SuperCrew cab (1999). Built on new P2 platform. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford F-Series (tenth generation) article, October 2025 revision.

First generation full-size SUV based on F-150 platform. Replaced Bronco as Ford's full-size SUV. All Triton V8 engines use timing chains. Independent rear suspension available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Expedition article, October 2025 revision.

Second generation Taurus with rounded aerodynamic styling. SHO models feature Yamaha-developed DOHC V6 with timing belt. Standard engines use timing chains. AXOD/AX4S transmissions known for reliability issues. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Taurus article, October 2025 revision.

Third generation with controversial oval styling. SHO model upgraded to Yamaha V8 (timing belt). Duratec V6 uses timing chains. Criticized for interior ergonomics. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Taurus article, October 2025 revision.

First Ford minivan designed from ground up. Replaced Aerostar. All engines use timing chains. AX4S transmission known for premature failure. Head gasket issues common on 3.8L Essex V6. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Windstar article, October 2025 revision.

North American version of Ford Mondeo on CDW27 platform. All engines use timing belts requiring replacement at 60k-100k miles. SVT model features sport-tuned suspension. CD4E transmission prone to failure. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Contour article, October 2025 revision.

Second generation Crown Victoria on Panther platform. Body-on-frame construction. 4.6L Modular V8 uses timing chains. Popular for police, taxi, and fleet use. Known for durability and simple maintenance. NOTE: Overlaps with 2000s entry - decade coverage split. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Crown Victoria article, October 2025 revision.

Third generation compact pickup with updated styling. Shares platform with Explorer. All engines use timing chains. Available with splash side graphics package. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Ranger (Americas) article, October 2025 revision.

Major facelift for third generation with updated front end. Introduced 4.0L SOHC V6 with timing chains. Edge and FX4 off-road packages available. NOTE: Overlaps with 2000s - decade coverage split. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Ranger (Americas) article, October 2025 revision.

Fifth generation redesign on Mazda 323 platform (BG). 1.9L CVH engine uses timing belt. GT model features Mazda BP engine with DOHC and timing belt. Replaced Escort EXP with more conventional styling. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Escort (North America) article, October 2025 revision.

Sixth generation with redesigned bodywork. 2.0L Zetec I4 uses timing belt requiring replacement every 100k miles. ZX2 sport coupe variant available. NOTE: Overlaps with 2000s - decade coverage split. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Escort (North America) article, October 2025 revision.

Compact van based on Ranger platform. First Ford minivan with rear-wheel drive layout. All engines use timing chains. AWD system available (first minivan with AWD). Replaced by Windstar in 1995 but continued through 1997. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Aerostar article, October 2025 revision.

Fifth generation full-size van. Diesel engines (7.3L, 6.0L, 6.4L Power Stroke) require specialized service knowledge - difficulty modifier 1.2. 6.0L known for reliability issues. 6.8L V10 uses timing chains. Popular for commercial and fleet use. NOTE: Overlaps multiple decades. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford E-Series article, October 2025 revision.

First year of Super Duty line replacing F-250/F-350 heavy-duty models. 7.3L Power Stroke diesel highly regarded for reliability but requires diesel service knowledge - difficulty modifier 1.2. Available in F-250, F-350, F-450, F-550 configurations. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Super Duty article, October 2025 revision.

Tenth generation on MN12 platform with aerodynamic styling. Super Coupe features supercharged 3.8L V6 (210 hp). All engines use timing chains. Shared platform with Mercury Cougar. Data sourced from Wikipedia Ford Thunderbird article, October 2025 revision.
NOTE: Explorer Sport Trac not officially launched until 2001. Removing this entry as it doesn't apply to 1990s production vehicles. Placeholder for reference only.
